comments:
I just installed the eclipse-SDK-3.2M6-linux-gtk.tar.gz and when trying to right-click on a resource in the JAVA-resource tree I get an error (and it asks me if I want to shut down the workspace).

The same goes for the Error-Log, so if it is enabled and the .log file is none-empty the workspace will not open at all.

When looking in the "about eclipse" -> "about plugins" the com.ibm.icu-plugin is loaded but it still fails.

Here is the stack-trace of the error:

Karice, here's the one I was talking about..
This looks like the same stack trace (see comment #2) as seen in bug 134689.  Are you using JDK 1.6?

Yes, my settings in eclipse is set to 1.6 and I am currently running: 
java version "1.6.0-beta2"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0-beta2-b78)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.6.0-beta2-b78, mixed mode, sharing)

(I need to, because of bug 81949 and http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6404691)

Well it seems this is bug 134689, but I did not have that problem with all combinations of Eclipse/JDK1.6-xxx, that is why I never though of changing JDK.

As soon as I figure out how to run Eclipse with Java1.5 and still use 1.6 for everything else I will write if the errors stop.

Yes this was just the Java1.6 JRE that was wrong, running eclipse with Java1.5 gives me back all right-click menues, and quick-fixes and everything. But I still think eclipse should work with 1.6 :-)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 134689 ***
In this case the problem is in ICU4J.  Since Eclipse doesn't officially support JDK1.6 then you cannot assume that you can safely use 1.6 with Eclipse at this time.

traces.message: Can't map string pool offset 20273 to index
Can't map string pool offset 20273 to index
